title: The Number Nexus
story: Numbers are everywhere in programming! Python can work with whole numbers (integers) and decimal numbers (floats). In this quest, you'll master basic arithmetic and learn how to perform calculations.
instructions: Create a variable `x` with value 10 and `y` with value 3. Then create variables for: `sum_result` (x + y), `diff_result` (x - y), `prod_result` (x * y), and `div_result` (x / y). Print all four results.
solutionHidden:
x = 10
y = 3
sum_result = x + y
diff_result = x - y
prod_result = x * y
div_result = x / y
print(sum_result)
print(diff_result)
print(prod_result)
print(div_result)

hints.text: Use +, -, *, and / operators for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
Store each calculation result in the appropriately named variable before printing
Create x=10, y=3, then sum_result = x + y, diff_result = x - y, etc. Print each result.
